content: During active treatment for breast cancer, patients are advised to engage in light walking for 20–30 minutes, three times per week.
title: ACSM Guidelines

content: Post-treatment patients should progressively increase to 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity per week, including strength training twice weekly at 40–60% of 1RM.
title: NCCN Survivorship Guidelines

content: For lung cancer survivors in post-treatment phase, start with low-impact exercises such as stationary biking and increase duration gradually, monitoring fatigue closely.
title: ESMO Recommendations

content: During chemotherapy, patients with prostate cancer are advised to perform supervised resistance training 2x/week to mitigate muscle loss.
title: ASCO Guidelines

content: Patients with leukemia in remission may engage in light yoga and balance training to rebuild neuromuscular coordination.
title: Leukemia Foundation Exercise Protocol

content: Fatigue-prone patients should adopt a conservative approach with flexibility exercises and short walks under supervision.
title: Cancer Fatigue Management Protocol

content: Breast cancer patients with obesity are encouraged to integrate aquatic exercises and dietary guidance, with at least 90 minutes/week of activity.
title: Obesity-Adapted ACSM Guidelines

content: Patients recovering from surgery (any cancer) should follow a gradual mobilization protocol starting within 48h under physiotherapy guidance.
title: ERAS Oncology Protocol

content: Older adults with endometrial cancer are recommended low-impact resistance band training to preserve bone density and reduce fall risk.
title: Geriatric Oncology Exercise Plan

content: During radiation treatment, light stationary cycling and deep breathing exercises are beneficial to maintain baseline endurance without overexertion.
title: Oncology Physical Therapy Association Guidelines

content: Obese prostate cancer survivors should combine strength training and brisk walking under dietician and physio supervision.
title: Obesity + Prostate Combined Protocol

content: Patients in long-term remission can participate in community sports adapted for survivors, such as walking clubs or aquatic groups.
title: Community Re-engagement Guide
